titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Margaret Stanley-Brown Papers, 1882–1958
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Elizabeth Clarke August 2007

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Correspondence, mostly from Dr. Margaret Stanley-Brown to her sister Ruth. The collection also includes letters to and from other family members.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Margaret Stanley-Brown, born in Washington, DC, was graduated from Vassar in 1919. Her sister Ruth was Vassar Class of 1915. Her mother Mary Garfield Stanley-Brown, was the daughter of President James A. Garfield. By her own account, "surgery was all" Margaret Stanley-Brown "ever wanted to do." She graduated from Columbia University’s College of Physicians and Surgeons in 1923. In addition to the surgical practice she established in New York City, Dr. Stanley-Brown was an instructor in the Department of Surgical Pathology at Columbia for twenty-five years. She was a diplomat of the American Board of Surgery, a fellow of the American College of Surgeons, and one of two women members of the New York Surgical Society. In 1950 she was married to Max K. Sellers, a writer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Personal letters from Stanley-Brown to her parents, her brother Rudolph, and her sister Ruth (Mrs. Herbert Feis), 1902-1958, concerning travel arrangements and sights seen, camping trip in Wyoming in 1922, her hospital and teaching duties, family visits, and other personal news; other family letters, including Rudolph's childhood letters to his parents; and a poem by Stanley-Brown to her mother about her non-traditional career, 1926.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Original processing date unknown. Last updated August 2007.
